## Natural history notes

Stinking camphorweed (Pluchea foetida) is a native wetland plant found throughout the southeastern United States. This wildflower attracts lots of pollinators and is a great choice in wildflower gardens! Its “stinking” name comes from the odor that the leaves emit when something touches it.
